headline: Chipotle raising US menu prices by 2% to counter inflation
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) announced its plans to raise its menu prices by 2% to offset the chain's rising ingredients costs. Chipotle's stock rose by as much as 5% in Wednesday's session while being up nearly 40% year-to-date. Market Domination hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton report this news, looking back at Chipotle's record of comparable sales growth. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Chipotle Stock Climbs As Menu Prices Increase

headline: Chipotle is raising prices again. What's behind the hike?
summary: Chipotle (CMG) fans, brace yourselves: Burritos, bowls, and chips are about to cost more. The company is raising prices by 2% nationwide to offset rising costs.

raw.headline: Chipotle is raising prices again. What's behind the hike?
raw.summary: Chipotle (CMG) fans, brace yourselves: Burritos, bowls, and chips are about to cost more. The company is raising prices by 2% nationwide to offset rising costs.

headline: Chipotle Mexican Grill lifts menu prices as input costs rise
summary: Inflation in input costs contributed to U.S. restaurants and fast-food chains increasing menu prices in 2023, which tempered demand from consumers.  As Chipotle lapped those price increases, executives said in October during a post-earnings call that it was still seeing a low-single-digit inflation on the cost of sales, as well as on labor.  However, given some softness in demand trends — Chipotle missed market expectations for quarterly same-store sales — the company had hinted that a price increase might come only in early 2025.

headline: Chipotle Raises U.S. Prices by 2% to Offset Inflation Costs
summary: The chain aims to balance higher costs for avocados, queso and sour cream while maintaining its appeal to inflation-weary consumers.

headline: Palantir stake, Chipotle prices, Nike: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance host Rachelle Akuffo reports on several of this morning's biggest market stories and top trending stocks: Duquesne Family Office — helmed by chairman and CEO Stanley Druckenmiller — sold 95% of their stake in Palantir (PLTR). In an attempt to offset inflation, Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) will be raising its prices by 2% across the US. According to a YouGov survey, Nike (NKE) is ranked as America's top fashion brand. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Chipotle shares rise as analyst says prices hikes have started
summary: Investing.com -- Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) shares rose more than 2% in premarket trading Wednesday after a Truist Securities analyst said that recent checks indicate price hikes of at least 2% at some stores.

headline: How Shake Shack founder Danny Meyer finds the next big thing in food
summary: The restaurant industry is more competitive and challenging than ever before. Mobile ordering is placing fresh pressures on the kitchen. Wage inflation is weighing on the industry’s profit margins, especially in top states such as California and New York. And food tastes are evolving as people aim to live healthier lifestyles. Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi sits down with celebrated restaurateur Danny Meyer to explore the world of restaurants. Meyer is the acclaimed author of “Setting the Table,” which many in the restaurant industry credit with establishing a new standard in hospitality. Meyer also founded Shake Shack (SHAK), helping to take it from a hot dog cart in New York City to a public company with hundreds of locations worldwide. The pair discuss the future of restaurants in America, and Meyer’s top advice to getting ahead in the competitive industry. For full episodes of Opening Bid, listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website.
